unnormalised: Hey auto enthusiasts! Buckle up, 'cause the Indian automotive scene is buzzing with new vehicle launches!
normalised: Hey auto enthusiasts! Buckle up, because the Indian automotive scene is buzzing with new vehicle launches!

unnormalised: First up, Mahindra unveiled its much-awaited Thar 5-door version in Rajasthan, promising a rugged ride for those off-road adventures we all crave. Expect some serious competition for the Maruti Suzuki Jimny.
normalised: First up, Mahindra unveiled its much awaited Thar five door version in Rajasthan, promising a rugged ride for those off road adventures we all crave. Expect some serious competition for the Maruti Suzuki Jimny.

unnormalised: Then, Tata Motors surprised everyone with a sneak peek of their sleek new sedan, rumored to be named Altroz EV. Dr. Sharma from ARAI was spotted checking it out, so you know it's legit. It's packing some impressive tech!
normalised: Then, Tata Motors surprised everyone with a sneak peek of their sleek new sedan, rumored to be named Altroz E V. Doctor Sharma from A R A I was spotted checking it out, so you know it is legit. It is packing some impressive tech!

unnormalised: Meanwhile, Hero MotoCorp launched a new scooter variant aimed at the college crowd, flaunting vibrant colours and claiming a mileage of 65 kmpl. Perfect for zipping around campus and impressing your crush!
normalised: Meanwhile, Hero MotoCorp launched a new scooter variant aimed at the college crowd, flaunting vibrant colours and claiming a mileage of sixty five kilometer per liter. Perfect for zipping around campus and impressing your crush!

unnormalised: And finally, some whispers about Ashok Leyland entering the electric bus market, aiming for a larger fleet in Bangalore. They're promising a low running cost of just Rs. 2 per km. Plus, a new dealership opened up in Chandni Chowk, spanning 5000 sq ft – huge! Lots happening in the automotive world, folks! Stay tuned for more updates.
normalised: And finally, some whispers about Ashok Leyland entering the electric bus market, aiming for a larger fleet in Bangalore. They are promising a low running cost of just rupees two per kilometer. Plus, a new dealership opened up in Chandni Chowk, spanning five thousand square feet – huge! Lots happening in the automotive world, folks! Stay tuned for more updates.
